text: A man hunted a cornet, tied a thread to its leg and handed it to his son. But the cornet, unable to resign herself to living as a prisoner in that home, used an instant of freedom in a careless way to escape and try to return to her nest. But the thread got tangled in the branches of a tree and the bird could not fly anymore, being trapped. When he saw that his death was near, he said, "It is done!" For not having been able to endure slavery among men, I now feel deprived of life. When you're looking for something valuable, the risks are greater.
title: La corneja fugitiva
author: nan Esopo
